mods.abstract: Black-and-white photograph of Brabson House located in Chattanooga, Tennessee. The Brabson House was built in 1857-1858, by Reese Brabson, a former Congressman. The home was a hospital during the early parts of the Civil War and later during the Yellow Fever Epidemic of 1878. The house pictured would be destroyed by a fire in 1881. The house was later rebuilt by D. B. Loveman and is still located on 5th street.

titleInfo.title: Downtown Chattanooga, Tennessee in 1800s photgraphic prints
Herman Lamb photographs
Special Collections
